metadata.title: CVE-2019-17673 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
WordPress before 5.2.4 is vulnerable to poisoning of the cache of JSON GETrequests because certain requests lack a Vary: Origin header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17673` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.4+dfsg1-1').
